Name: Letter of Amenhotep III to Milkilu
Description: This cuneiform tablet  was found in the diplomatic archives of Tell El-`Amarna. The letter, written in Akkadian, is a demand on the part of the palace chancellory  to a vassal of the pharaoh, named Milkilu from Gezer, to obtain 40 women for the royal harem. The mention of the Egyptian god Amun leads us to date the tablet to the reign of Amenhotep III, father of Akhenaten.
